metadata.title: CVE-2013-7426 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Insecure Temporary file vulnerability in /tmp/kamailio_fifo in kamailio4.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kamailio - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-berkeley-bin - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-berkeley-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-carrierroute-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-cpl-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-geoip-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-ims-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-json-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-ldap-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-lua-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-memcached-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-mono-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-mysql-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-perl-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-postgres-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-presence-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-python-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-radius-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-redis-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-snmpstats-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-sqlite-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-unixodbc-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-utils-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-xml-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
kamailio-xmpp-modules - 4.0.4-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kamailio package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.4-1ubuntu2').
